This is where I park my butt a few nights a week.  The service is typical as is the wine, but the atmosphere is just lovely and lovely in only a NYC transplant can love.  It's hipster--and when you're not around hipsters all the time you miss it.Not only does it have comfortable couches, but one can get actual absinth served properly there.  I do recommend trying the absinth at least once, but my current alcohol tolerance left it for a experience--headache in the morning--however I consistently go back because I love the homemade art and eclectic music they play.If any of this sounds appealing then you will like the clientele as well.  It's a great place to have a random chat with arty types from all over Spain and France.
